meanings.definition: (Latin) to hand over, deliver; to betray
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to hand over, deliver; to betray

etymology.value: From Latin *trādō* (“I hand over, deliver”), from *trāns-* (“across, over”) + *dō* (“I give”).

usage_notes.explanation: Trado is a Latin verb. It is important in historical and religious contexts.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, so readability is dependent on Latin knowledge.
